means: [俚]轻易地取胜，不费力地完成
read-only memory, programmable 可编程只读存储器

sentence.Network_en: The child went for a romp in the forest.
sentence.Network_cn: 那个孩子去森林快活一把.

sentence.Network_en: Kids just love being able to romp around in the fresh air without having to wrap up warm.
sentence.Network_cn: 孩子们非常喜欢不用裹着厚实的衣服在空气新鲜的户外嬉闹。

sentence.Network_en: This is easy stuff , we'll romp through this.
sentence.Network_cn: 这很容易, 我们轻而易举便能做好.

PerfectNetExp.exp: 开环易位聚合(Ring-Opening Metathesis Polymerization)
PerfectNetExp.abs: ］中的开环易位聚合 (ROMP) 反应，反应体系保持均相，无聚合物析出，得到两端为叔溴的遥爪型官能化聚合物(Br-PNBEDE-Br).以B…
《Friends》词汇表B ... chipmunk n. [动] 花栗鼠 romp n. 蹦跳游戏, 顽皮的人 gather n. 集合, 聚集.
嬉_百度百科 ... 嬉耍[ romp] 嬉戏[ frolic;romp] 嬉笑[ laughing and playing].
2006年英语专业八级考试全真试卷... ... grimace v. 扮鬼脸,作苦相 romp v. 嬉闹，顽皮地玩耍 theologian n. 神学者,空头理论家.

list.abs: The children and their dog were romping about on the grass., 孩子们 , 还有狗在草地上蹦跳嬉戏.
romeo 橡胶鞋romp home 轻易取胜romp 蹦跳游戏
He romped through his examinations ., 他很轻易地通过考试.
She romped through her exams ., 她毫不费力就考及格了.
They romped home ., 他们轻松取胜.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent.: perhaps an alteration of ramp

entry.def: Journalists use romp in expressions like romp home ,romp in, or romp to victory, to say that a person or horse has won a race or competition very easily.

example.ex: Mr Foster romped home with 141 votes.
example.tran: 福斯特先生以141票轻松获胜。

entry.def: When children or animals romp, they play noisily and happily.

example.ex: Dogs and little children romped happily in the garden.
example.tran: 狗和小孩子们在花园里嬉戏。

entry.def: If two people have a romp, they have sex in a light-hearted and very casual way.

entry.tran: 轻松逗笑的书;笑料百出的电影(或话剧)
entry.def: Journalists describe a book, film, or play as a romp when it is funny, light-hearted, and full of action.

example.tran: 一本让人爱不释手的、轻松易懂且妙趣横生的书

means.word_mean: 2. a girl who behaves in a boyish manner
3. gay or light-hearted recreational activity for diversion or amusement;

sentences.sentence: "their frolic in the surf threatened to become ugly"

孩子们在操场上嬉笑玩闹。

means.word_mean: (尤指在赛跑或竞选等中)轻易获胜

sentences.en: The Queen’s horse romped home in the first race.
sentences.cn: 女王的马在第一场比赛中轻松胜出。

sentences.en: The Democratic Party romped to victory in the recent elections.
sentences.cn: 民主党在最近几次选举中轻而易举地获胜。
